Mon., Mar. 12: Oppose Senate Bill 65 and stand up against discrimination.
  


#INLegis Action: Stand for LGBTQ Hoosiers

Monday, March 12, 10:30 a.m.
Indiana Statehouse
200 W Washington St RM 130
Indianapolis, IN 46204

RSVP Today
Share this:           

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

This is urgent. On Monday, March 12, Indiana lawmakers will have a chance to reinsert discriminatory language in Senate Bill 65 that would prevent teachers from discussing any LGBTQ issues without express written permission from parents.

This kind of language would harm LGBTQ students and make it harder for teachers to stop bullying and harassment.

Join us to pack the committee hearing room on Monday and send a clear message that discrimination is not a Hoosier value.

This provision is so extreme that it was removed last month by members of the House, but now there are signs that lawmakers are trying to bring it back from the dead.

We can't let that happen. We need to stop this unnecessary and harmful language so our educators can teach, support, and protect ALL Indiana students.

Can't make it? Email members of the committee and leadership to tell them to keep discriminatory language out of SB 65.

  • Senator Kruse: s14@iga.in.gov

  • Senator Stoops: s40@iga.in.gov

  • Representative Errington: h34@iga.in.gov

  • Representative Wesco: h21@iga.in.gov

  • Speaker Bosma: h88@iga.in.gov

  • Senate Pro Tem Long: s16@iga.in.gov

Onward,

Katie Blair
Director of Advocacy and Public Policy
ACLU of Indiana
